table.name: admissions
table.remarks: Hospital admissions associated with an ICU stay.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Primary key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: admittime
column.remarks: Time of admission to the hospital.

column.name: dischtime
column.remarks: Time of discharge from the hospital.

column.name: deathtime
column.remarks: Time of death.

column.name: admission_type
column.remarks: Type of admission, for example emergency or elective.

column.name: admission_location
column.remarks: Admission location.

column.name: discharge_location
column.remarks: Discharge location

column.name: insurance
column.remarks: Insurance type.

column.name: marital_status
column.remarks: Marital status.

column.name: has_chartevents_data
column.remarks: Hospital admission has at least one observation in the CHARTEVENTS table.

table.name: callout
table.remarks: Record of when patients were ready for discharge (called out), and the actual time of their discharge (or more generally, their outcome).

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: submit_wardid
column.remarks: Identifies the ward where the call out request was submitted.

column.name: submit_careunit
column.remarks: If the ward where the call was submitted was an ICU, the ICU type is listed here.

column.name: curr_wardid
column.remarks: Identifies the ward where the patient is currently residing.

column.name: curr_careunit
column.remarks: If the ward where the patient is currently residing is an ICU, the ICU type is listed here.

column.name: callout_wardid
column.remarks: Identifies the ward where the patient is to be discharged to. A value of 1 indicates the first available ward. A value of 0 indicates home.

column.name: callout_service
column.remarks: Identifies the service that the patient is called out to.

column.name: request_tele
column.remarks: Indicates if special precautions are required.

column.name: request_resp
column.remarks: Indicates if special precautions are required.

column.name: request_cdiff
column.remarks: Indicates if special precautions are required.

column.name: request_mrsa
column.remarks: Indicates if special precautions are required.

column.name: request_vre
column.remarks: Indicates if special precautions are required.

column.name: callout_status
column.remarks: Current status of the call out request.

column.name: callout_outcome
column.remarks: The result of the call out request; either a cancellation or a discharge.

column.name: discharge_wardid
column.remarks: The ward to which the patient was discharged.

column.name: acknowledge_status
column.remarks: The status of the response to the call out request.

column.name: createtime
column.remarks: Time at which the call out request was created.

column.name: updatetime
column.remarks: Last time at which the call out request was updated.

column.name: acknowledgetime
column.remarks: Time at which the call out request was acknowledged.

column.name: outcometime
column.remarks: Time at which the outcome (cancelled or discharged) occurred.

column.name: firstreservationtime
column.remarks: First time at which a ward was reserved for the call out request.

column.name: currentreservationtime
column.remarks: Latest time at which a ward was reserved for the call out request.

table.name: caregivers
table.remarks: List of caregivers associated with an ICU stay.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: cgid
column.remarks: Unique caregiver identifier.

column.name: label
column.remarks: Title of the caregiver, for example MD or RN.

column.name: description
column.remarks: More detailed description of the caregiver, if available.

table.name: chartevents
table.remarks: Events occuring on a patient chart.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: icustay_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the ICU stay.

column.name: itemid
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the charted item.

column.name: charttime
column.remarks: Time when the event occured.

column.name: storetime
column.remarks: Time when the event was recorded in the system.

column.name: cgid
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the caregiver.

column.name: value
column.remarks: Value of the event as a text string.

column.name: valuenum
column.remarks: Value of the event as a number.

column.name: valueuom
column.remarks: Unit of measurement.

column.name: warning
column.remarks: Flag to highlight that the value has triggered a warning.

column.name: error
column.remarks: Flag to highlight an error with the event.

column.name: resultstatus
column.remarks: Result status of lab data.

column.name: stopped
column.remarks: Text string indicating the stopped status of an event (i.e. stopped, not stopped).

table.name: cptevents
table.remarks: Events recorded in Current Procedural Terminology.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: costcenter
column.remarks: Center recording the code, for example the ICU or the respiratory unit.

column.name: chartdate
column.remarks: Date when the event occured, if available.

column.name: cpt_cd
column.remarks: Current Procedural Terminology code.

column.name: cpt_number
column.remarks: Numerical element of the Current Procedural Terminology code.

column.name: cpt_suffix
column.remarks: Text element of the Current Procedural Terminology, if any. Indicates code category.

column.name: ticket_id_seq
column.remarks: Sequence number of the event, derived from the ticket ID.

column.name: sectionheader
column.remarks: High-level section of the Current Procedural Terminology code.

column.name: subsectionheader
column.remarks: Subsection of the Current Procedural Terminology code.

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of the Current Procedural Terminology, if available.

table.name: d_cpt
table.remarks: High-level dictionary of the Current Procedural Terminology.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: category
column.remarks: Code category.

column.name: sectionrange
column.remarks: Range of codes within the high-level section.

column.name: sectionheader
column.remarks: Section header.

column.name: subsectionrange
column.remarks: Range of codes within the subsection.

column.name: subsectionheader
column.remarks: Subsection header.

column.name: codesuffix
column.remarks: Text element of the Current Procedural Terminology, if any.

column.name: mincodeinsubsection
column.remarks: Minimum code within the subsection.

column.name: maxcodeinsubsection
column.remarks: Maximum code within the subsection.

table.name: d_icd_diagnoses
table.remarks: Dictionary of the International Classification of Diseases, 9th Revision (Diagnoses).

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: icd9_code
column.remarks: ICD9 code - note that this is a fixed length character field, as whitespaces are important in uniquely identifying ICD-9 codes.

column.name: short_title
column.remarks: Short title associated with the code.

column.name: long_title
column.remarks: Long title associated with the code.

table.name: d_icd_procedures
table.remarks: Dictionary of the International Classification of Diseases, 9th Revision (Procedures).

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: icd9_code
column.remarks: ICD9 code - note that this is a fixed length character field, as whitespaces are important in uniquely identifying ICD-9 codes.

column.name: short_title
column.remarks: Short title associated with the code.

column.name: long_title
column.remarks: Long title associated with the code.

table.name: d_items
table.remarks: Dictionary of non-laboratory-related charted items.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: itemid
column.remarks: Primary key. Identifies the charted item.

column.name: label
column.remarks: Label identifying the item.

column.name: abbreviation
column.remarks: Abbreviation associated with the item.

column.name: dbsource
column.remarks: Source database of the item.

column.name: linksto
column.remarks: Table which contains data for the given ITEMID.

column.name: category
column.remarks: Category of data which the concept falls under.

column.name: unitname
column.remarks: Unit associated with the item.

column.name: param_type
column.remarks: Type of item, for example solution or ingredient.

column.name: conceptid
column.remarks: Identifier used to harmonize concepts identified by multiple ITEMIDs. CONCEPTIDs are planned but not yet implemented (all values are NULL).

table.name: d_labitems
table.remarks: Dictionary of laboratory-related items.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: itemid
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the charted item.

column.name: label
column.remarks: Label identifying the item.

column.name: fluid
column.remarks: Fluid associated with the item, for example blood or urine.

column.name: category
column.remarks: Category of item, for example chemistry or hematology.

column.name: loinc_code
column.remarks: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) mapped to the item, if available.

table.name: datetimeevents
table.remarks: Events relating to a datetime.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: icustay_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the ICU stay.

column.name: itemid
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the charted item.

column.name: charttime
column.remarks: Time when the event occured.

column.name: storetime
column.remarks: Time when the event was recorded in the system.

column.name: cgid
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the caregiver.

column.name: value
column.remarks: Value of the event as a text string.

column.name: valueuom
column.remarks: Unit of measurement.

column.name: warning
column.remarks: Flag to highlight that the value has triggered a warning.

column.name: error
column.remarks: Flag to highlight an error with the event.

column.name: resultstatus
column.remarks: Result status of lab data.

column.name: stopped
column.remarks: Event was explicitly marked as stopped. Infrequently used by caregivers.

table.name: diagnoses_icd
table.remarks: Diagnoses relating to a hospital admission coded using the ICD9 system.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: seq_num
column.remarks: Priority of the code. Sequence 1 is the primary code.

column.name: icd9_code
column.remarks: ICD9 code for the diagnosis.

table.name: drgcodes
table.remarks: Hospital stays classified using the Diagnosis-Related Group system.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: drg_type
column.remarks: Type of Diagnosis-Related Group, for example APR is All Patient Refined

column.name: drg_code
column.remarks: Diagnosis-Related Group code

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of the Diagnosis-Related Group

column.name: drg_severity
column.remarks: Relative severity, available for type APR only.

column.name: drg_mortality
column.remarks: Relative mortality, available for type APR only.

table.name: icustays
table.remarks: List of ICU admissions.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: icustay_id
column.remarks: Primary key. Identifies the ICU stay.

column.name: dbsource
column.remarks: Source database of the item.

column.name: first_careunit
column.remarks: First careunit associated with the ICU stay.

column.name: last_careunit
column.remarks: Last careunit associated with the ICU stay.

column.name: first_wardid
column.remarks: Identifier for the first ward the patient was located in.

column.name: last_wardid
column.remarks: Identifier for the last ward the patient is located in.

column.name: intime
column.remarks: Time of admission to the ICU.

column.name: outtime
column.remarks: Time of discharge from the ICU.

column.name: los
column.remarks: Length of stay in the ICU in minutes.

table.name: inputevents_cv
table.remarks: Events relating to fluid input for patients whose data was originally stored in the CareVue database.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: icustay_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the ICU stay.

column.name: charttime
column.remarks: Time of that the input was started or received.

column.name: itemid
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the charted item.

column.name: amount
column.remarks: Amount of the item administered to the patient.

column.name: amountuom
column.remarks: Unit of measurement for the amount.

column.name: rate
column.remarks: Rate at which the item is being administered to the patient.

column.name: rateuom
column.remarks: Unit of measurement for the rate.

column.name: storetime
column.remarks: Time when the event was recorded in the system.

column.name: cgid
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the caregiver.

column.name: orderid
column.remarks: Identifier linking items which are grouped in a solution.

column.name: linkorderid
column.remarks: Identifier linking orders across multiple administrations. LINKORDERID is always equal to the first occuring ORDERID of the series.

column.name: stopped
column.remarks: Event was explicitly marked as stopped. Infrequently used by caregivers.

column.name: newbottle
column.remarks: Indicates when a new bottle of the solution was hung at the bedside.

column.name: originalamount
column.remarks: Amount of the item which was originally charted.

column.name: originalamountuom
column.remarks: Unit of measurement for the original amount.

column.name: originalroute
column.remarks: Route of administration originally chosen for the item.

column.name: originalrate
column.remarks: Rate of administration originally chosen for the item.

column.name: originalrateuom
column.remarks: Unit of measurement for the rate originally chosen.

column.name: originalsite
column.remarks: Anatomical site for the original administration of the item.

table.name: inputevents_mv
table.remarks: Events relating to fluid input for patients whose data was originally stored in the MetaVision database.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: icustay_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the ICU stay.

column.name: starttime
column.remarks: Time when the event started.

column.name: endtime
column.remarks: Time when the event ended.

column.name: itemid
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the charted item.

column.name: amount
column.remarks: Amount of the item administered to the patient.

column.name: amountuom
column.remarks: Unit of measurement for the amount.

column.name: rate
column.remarks: Rate at which the item is being administered to the patient.

column.name: rateuom
column.remarks: Unit of measurement for the rate.

column.name: storetime
column.remarks: Time when the event was recorded in the system.

column.name: cgid
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the caregiver.

column.name: orderid
column.remarks: Identifier linking items which are grouped in a solution.

column.name: linkorderid
column.remarks: Identifier linking orders across multiple administrations. LINKORDERID is always equal to the first occuring ORDERID of the series.

column.name: ordercategoryname
column.remarks: A group which the item corresponds to.

column.name: secondaryordercategoryname
column.remarks: A secondary group for those items with more than one grouping possible.

column.name: ordercomponenttypedescription
column.remarks: The role of the item administered in the order.

column.name: ordercategorydescription
column.remarks: The type of item administered.

column.name: patientweight
column.remarks: For drugs dosed by weight, the value of the weight used in the calculation.

column.name: totalamount
column.remarks: The total amount in the solution for the given item.

column.name: totalamountuom
column.remarks: Unit of measurement for the total amount in the solution.

column.name: isopenbag
column.remarks: Indicates whether the bag containing the solution is open.

column.name: continueinnextdept
column.remarks: Indicates whether the item will be continued in the next department where the patient is transferred to.

column.name: cancelreason
column.remarks: Reason for cancellation, if cancelled.

column.name: statusdescription
column.remarks: The current status of the order: stopped, rewritten, running or cancelled.

column.name: comments_editedby
column.remarks: The title of the caregiver who edited the order.

column.name: comments_canceledby
column.remarks: The title of the caregiver who canceled the order.

column.name: comments_date
column.remarks: Time at which the caregiver edited or cancelled the order.

column.name: originalamount
column.remarks: Amount of the item which was originally charted.

column.name: originalrate
column.remarks: Rate of administration originally chosen for the item.

table.name: labevents
table.remarks: Events relating to laboratory tests.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: itemid
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the charted item.

column.name: charttime
column.remarks: Time when the event occured.

column.name: value
column.remarks: Value of the event as a text string.

column.name: valuenum
column.remarks: Value of the event as a number.

column.name: valueuom
column.remarks: Unit of measurement.

column.name: flag
column.remarks: Flag indicating whether the lab test value is considered abnormal (null if the test was normal).

table.name: microbiologyevents
table.remarks: Events relating to microbiology tests.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: chartdate
column.remarks: Date when the event occured.

column.name: charttime
column.remarks: Time when the event occured, if available.

column.name: spec_itemid
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the specimen.

column.name: spec_type_desc
column.remarks: Description of the specimen.

column.name: org_itemid
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the organism.

column.name: org_name
column.remarks: Name of the organism.

column.name: isolate_num
column.remarks: Isolate number associated with the test.

column.name: ab_itemid
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the antibody.

column.name: ab_name
column.remarks: Name of the antibody used.

column.name: dilution_text
column.remarks: The dilution amount tested for and the comparison which was made against it (e.g. <=4).

column.name: dilution_comparison
column.remarks: The comparison component of DILUTION_TEXT: either <= (less than or equal), = (equal), or >= (greater than or equal), or null when not available.

column.name: dilution_value
column.remarks: The value component of DILUTION_TEXT: must be a floating point number.

column.name: interpretation
column.remarks: Interpretation of the test.

table.name: noteevents
table.remarks: Notes associated with hospital stays.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: chartdate
column.remarks: Date when the note was charted.

column.name: charttime
column.remarks: Date and time when the note was charted. Note that some notes (e.g. discharge summaries) do not have a time associated with them: these notes have NULL in this column.

column.name: category
column.remarks: Category of the note, e.g. Discharge summary.

column.name: description
column.remarks: A more detailed categorization for the note, sometimes entered by free-text.

column.name: cgid
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the caregiver.

column.name: iserror
column.remarks: Flag to highlight an error with the note.

column.name: text
column.remarks: Content of the note.

table.name: patients
table.remarks: Patients associated with an admission to the ICU.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Primary key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: dob
column.remarks: Date of birth.

column.name: dod
column.remarks: Date of death. Null if the patient was alive at least 90 days post hospital discharge.

column.name: dod_hosp
column.remarks: Date of death recorded in the hospital records.

column.name: dod_ssn
column.remarks: Date of death recorded in the social security records.

column.name: expire_flag
column.remarks: Flag indicating that the patient has died.

table.name: prescriptions
table.remarks: Medicines prescribed.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: icustay_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the ICU stay.

column.name: startdate
column.remarks: Date when the prescription started.

column.name: enddate
column.remarks: Date when the prescription ended.

column.name: drug_type
column.remarks: Type of drug.

column.name: drug
column.remarks: Name of the drug.

column.name: drug_name_poe
column.remarks: Name of the drug on the Provider Order Entry interface.

column.name: drug_name_generic
column.remarks: Generic drug name.

column.name: formulary_drug_cd
column.remarks: Formulary drug code.

column.name: gsn
column.remarks: Generic Sequence Number.

column.name: ndc
column.remarks: National Drug Code.

column.name: prod_strength
column.remarks: Strength of the drug (product).

column.name: dose_val_rx
column.remarks: Dose of the drug prescribed.

column.name: dose_unit_rx
column.remarks: Unit of measurement associated with the dose.

column.name: form_val_disp
column.remarks: Amount of the formulation dispensed.

column.name: form_unit_disp
column.remarks: Unit of measurement associated with the formulation.

column.name: route
column.remarks: Route of administration, for example intravenous or oral.

table.name: procedures_icd
table.remarks: Procedures relating to a hospital admission coded using the ICD9 system.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: seq_num
column.remarks: Lower procedure numbers occurred earlier.

column.name: icd9_code
column.remarks: ICD9 code associated with the procedure.

table.name: services
table.remarks: Hospital services that patients were under during their hospital stay.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: transfertime
column.remarks: Time when the transfer occured.

column.name: prev_service
column.remarks: Previous service type.

column.name: curr_service
column.remarks: Current service type.

table.name: transfers
table.remarks: Location of patients during their hospital stay.

column.name: row_id
column.remarks: Unique row identifier.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the patient.

column.name: hadm_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the hospital stay.

column.name: icustay_id
column.remarks: Foreign key. Identifies the ICU stay.

column.name: dbsource
column.remarks: Source database of the item.

column.name: eventtype
column.remarks: Type of event, for example admission or transfer.

column.name: prev_careunit
column.remarks: Previous careunit.

column.name: curr_careunit
column.remarks: Current careunit.

column.name: prev_wardid
column.remarks: Identifier for the previous ward the patient was located in.

column.name: curr_wardid
column.remarks: Identifier for the current ward the patient is located in.

column.name: intime
column.remarks: Time when the patient was transferred into the unit.

column.name: outtime
column.remarks: Time when the patient was transferred out of the unit.

column.name: los
column.remarks: Length of stay in the unit in minutes.
